revised_title: Interpretation of Refraction Experiments in the North Sea: Evolution of Sedimentary Basins
tldr: This article discusses the results of refraction experiments conducted in the North Sea to study the deep crustal and upper mantle structures beneath the region. The authors used seismic data to interpret the Mohorovicic discontinuity (Moho) and found evidence of an anticlinal form beneath the Moray Firth Basin. The study provides important constraints on the evolution of sedimentary basins in the North Sea.
